One of two of my favorite sushi places located in the middle of the desert! Located on the west side, Lahaina Grill caters to the locals of Summerlin and the surrounding area. The 24 hour sushi is no longer available but they do still serve it up until 4am.

Lots of special rolls to choose from on their menu...one of my favorites, the Lahaina Special (of course.) They also have a happy hour sushi menu that is quite an excellent value. 

The interior is unique (in a good way) with a tropical setting and the restaurant is clean. There is a full bar with video poker machines built in, a sushi bar (no machines) and plenty of table seating throughout. There's also a private room that can be reserved for meetings and parties that is sealed off with big windows and doors so you can be as loud and rowdy as you want without disturbing other patrons. I miss my old company's monthly meetings in there. I really enjoyed being able to order sushi at 9am on a weekday during a business meeting or rolling in at 3am after a night of partying craving sushi. Well worth the drive to the west side if you happen to live east of the Strip.
i feel like the year was productive in most areas of my life

Man I forgot how good the pizza was. It was thick crunch yet soft. My wife and I will definitely go back. And the service was good. I think our server was over sat with customers but he did his best to make it pleasant.

I have never written a review but felt I just had to after staying at this hotel. This was our first trip to New York City and we worked very hard to research the best price, location and amenities. This was a family reunion so we reserved 3 rooms total and each one was a little different from the other. We were traveling from December 26th through December 29th 2006.
This Comfort Inn was adorable because it was a "boutique style" so you didn't feel like you where in a typical cookie cutter chain hotel. It was located on 35th street between 5th and 6th so it was walking distance to the Empire State Building, around the corner from Macy's and many other shops and even had an attached resturant ( with the best pizza I've had in a long time I might add) where you recieved a 15% discount as a guest at the hotel. This was also where the contenential breakfast was served each morning. With four teenages in our group it was enough to fill them up so all we had to buy was a hot dog on the street for lunch and then a nice dinner.
A half a block away was a Starbucks, 24 hour drug store , subway station and deli. Across the street were two irish pubs (not loud) and parking.
Upon arrival our rooms were ready early and we checked right in. There was also a very friendly and helpful bellman at the curb to help us unload. He was also there the day we left to help us load our car.
The rooms were not huge but were very clean with new up to date bedding, new carpet and very comfortable beds. The bathroom was also very clean and adequit for our needs.
It's easy to see you are in an old building when you are there with the old marble and wood staircase and very small eleveators but that really added to the charm of being in NYC!
I am very picky about hotels and I thought this was great. If you are looking for the best value with an ideal location, look no further. This is the place to stay.
The best place you can find any music you want

The purpose of our visit was to welcome our son Jeremy, and his co-rider Wesley Barrientos to Washington DC as they completed their 100 day cross-country bicycle ride from Bakersfield, Calif. to Washington,DC for Veterans Awareness. This hotel was recommended by our travel agent, Lorna Young of Sierra West Travel in Porterville, California. It was an excellent choice.
It is located in the heart of the Downtown area. Easy access to all the Monuments, White House, Metro, and tours.
The rooms are verry comfortable, well maintained and the staff was great and very helpful and had knowledge of what is where! No question, I would stay there again.

I have been staying at this hotel annually for the Texas vs. OU game. For the last several years both the condition of the property and the service have been getting increasingly worse. We were going to change hotels but the hotel boasted about the new ownership and all the money spent to renovate every single guest roome - i'm sorry the place again is worse - and the renovations clearly missed all of the 2nd floor. Carpets are filthy, sinks wont drain. The beds are really comfortable so that is a plus. The front desk staff is usually rude. As an example, i booked 3 rooms in my name for our group. Each person was with me at check in and wanted to transfer the rooms to their credit card. The front desk staff made this almost impossible. I finally had to threaten that i would deny the charges - then a manager appeared and they fixed it. The sign at the front says "new management that wants to ensure a 10 rated experience." I just haven't seen it. For next years game, we will look for somewhere else to stay.

Upon my arrival in Vegas my friends Jeffrey L and Clarisse C, suggested that we go to Earl's. They usually know the best spots to eat, so I trusted their judgement for this.

I ordered the hawaiian bbq, and was completely in love with it! I figured the bread might get soggy because of the sauce, but it wasn't at all! The bread was tasty too, and very light. I became quite the fan and made frequent visits here on my trip.

I tried the Caprese sandwich which is basically slices of mozzarella cheese and tomatoes. This by far was my absolute favorite sandwich there. The vinagerette was perfect with the melted cheese and the tomatoes were just perfect! 

Price was decent too, if you're on a budget for food in Vegas, I'd definitely suggest Earl's, there are plenty of choices to choose from, and you'll want to try just about everything on the menu!

Nice environment. Fancy food, a bit pricey.

We bought their Groupon Deal which consist of soup, salad, main course and desert.The soup came in potato and leek soup (pretty tasty) and roast duck with vege (alright).The salad was classical prawn cocktail (alright) and tuna carpaccio (this was surprisingly really good!).The mains were filo wrapped salmon fillet (my father-in-law didn't like it), porky cordon bleu (this was pretty good), and fiery ribs (alright). We wanted the prawn and pork sizzling but was disappointed they did not have that even though we were one of the first diners there that night.The desert was vanilla or chocolate ice cream which was nothing to shout about.So overall, more hits than misses. It was a bit pricey tho and if not for the Groupon deal, we may not have gone there to eat with all the cheaper hawker stalls in Ipoh.

In May 2014, I went on a search to find a workout partner...simply to help keep me motivated. What I found was Seth at TPT, and group training. For the longest time, my body and weight were stagnant. Even though I was trying everything...I wasn't seeing any positive changes and I was losing motivation. I went for my physical assessment on May 12th and it's been an amazing transition so far! I literally saw results in the first two weeks of training...and my physical energy is through the roof!! It doesn't matter what age or level of fitness you're at, Seth and the trainers at TPT are extremely knowledgeable about customizing the training and diet specifically for what YOU need...without breaking the bank either! I've gained so many great things since joining the TPT family...great training, great results, great friends and on my way to a great body!!!

Just returned from a 3 night stay with my wife. This hotel is superb- the staff really make you feel welcome from the minute you arrive to the minute you leave. This hotel really made our NY trip exceptional. Would definitely recommend and return- hopefully sooner rather than later.

I LOVE this place. Are the hours too short? Yes. Would I prefer a larger, more central location? Of course. But, unless the prices are jacked to the sky, I will keep going there for the food and the philosophy. 

The croissants are, bar-none, the best in the valley. No joke. They are buttery, flakey, flavorful (my mouth is watering as I write this) and worth twice what I pay for them. The chocolate croissants are heaven on a plate. I will say that I was slightly disappointed in the almond croissant, not because it wasn't good, but because it was too sweet compared to the plan or chocolate ones. 

I love my mochas, as well, and they have a great one here. I highly recommend it with one caveat: the mocha is perfectly sweetened UNLESS you eat a sweet item before it. Therefore, when buying both a chocolate croissant and a mocha (which I often do,) either drink the mocha first, or eat the croissant and wait before tasting the mocha. Trust me, they are both delicious if eaten correctly :)

The macaroons are amazing! I prefer the creamy ones (hazelnut, vanilla, caramel, dulce de leche, pumpkin) but some people prefer the fruity ones with jam in them. The chocolate has a fudgy, not creamy filling. It's still good, but it's not what I was expecting.

As I said, their philosophy is awesome. They buy local and organic, compost, use sustainable resources and recycle. What can I say? It's everything I want in a restaurant!

Try to avoid this place at lunch because it is CRAZY busy. But tasty, tasty, tasty.

YUM!

I have recently become a vegetarian (NO MEAT!) and really enjoy having a strictly vegetarian eatery within a half hour drive.

The food here is amazing & makes me come back for more.

Anyone who likes good food or is trying to cut down their meat consumption, should definitely check out the Green Vegetarian Restaurant.

My husband and I traveled to Chicago for a family wedding. We reserved our room through a group rate for the wedding. We asked for a King bed, but was told it might not be possible. When we checked in we asked again for a King and was told one was available. The room was nice, but the bathroom is very small. My husband and I could not be in the bathroom at the same time. As always with a Holiday Inn hotel, the staff was very nice and helpful. They hotel had two restaurants attached to it. The food was okay, nothing to rave about. There is no parking at the hotel, except valet. The price varies on who you talk with. Online it states valet parking is $44 a night, a hotel staff stated it was $35 a night, and we ended up being charged $30 a night. So ask about the price of valet parking. The hotel is close to Union Station and a CTA blue line stop. Overall, we had a good stay with a wonderful staff.

So good we returned for another meal! Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious, in particular the morning glory and pork belly! I'm sure we would have returned for a third time if we had longer in Georgetown!

Sek Yuen is an old school chinese restaurant. Even the waiters are old school with a friendly smile. They would make nice recommendations if you are a first timer. The chicken with fish paste was nice as was the pei pa duck. Give it a try. Just hop off the PUDU lrt.. turn left as you exit the station and you get to its back entrance. They still use wood fire to cook.
Very nice little place- clean and modern. Had veggie Laksa which I didn‚Äôt see on the menu but asked for after reading reviews here. Really loved it!
Ordered DVD in advance. Arrived promptly for collection at local store. Pick up simple. No problem with any of this process.

I can't even tell you how wonderful the peruvian cuisine is here. Actually, I can. I went to this place because I live very close by. I didn't expect much when walking in. Decor is cool, but it was not busy at all which worried me. We asked the waiter what his fave dish was and he said the Lomo Saltado. I ordered it and fell in love the minute the food touched my lips. It's quality beef strips, sauteed with white onions and sliced tomoatoes. It is cooked in a vinegar/beer marinade and tossed with french fries. My husband got the Milanesa. It is breaded steak with a side of a beautiful pesto pasta. We haven't tried any seafood here but that happens to be one of their specialties. This place is perfect for a date night, or bringing family to for a night of great food.

I'm not typically a breakfast kind of guy, but occasionally I get a craving for breakfast foods. Whenever I get this craving, U.S. Egg is my go-to place. The half-and-half breakfast is the best of both worlds, you get a great egg and potato skillet plus their awesome protein pancakes.

I stumbled upon this movie on cable and was totally hooked. The story of a group of surfers who ride the big waves, waves that are monstrously huge, waves that would make any rational person run away in terror is a one that manages to be spectacular and make you understand why people spend their lives chasing waves. There is nothing special about the film, other than it brings together some very interesting people who are are in love with what they do and lets them talk. Sure there are scenes of them surfing, but what makes this movie so special is the people. Here are a bunch of guys who are so enthusiastic about what they do that it crosses over to the people watching. Half way into this movie you'll want to go off and learn to surf as well. Few documentaries have ever managed to covey the passion that these people have and its the films ability to make us feel it that makes this a great film. See it.

i feel very invigorated probably because i just drank my second cup of coffee today and to be honest i havent eaten much aside from a couple pieces of toast and a little at a bbq hassan invited me too

I love it here! They are so friendly and remember you. I just love the staff from the phone, to the front desk, to sitting in the chair. The atmosphere is very relaxing and modern.\nI feel like I'm in excellent hands and taken care of. They listen, are patient, and discuss options with me.

We are in Memphis for a birthday getaway... tickets to a Grizzlies game, yummy food, etc... I have stayed at the Peabody several times but never at the Madison, although I had looked into it more than once.
I "price-lined" our room and paid $335 for two nights, taxes and fees included. I had read a couple reviews on Trip Advisor that people felt they were given a "poor location" because of using PriceLine to acquire their room... We did, in fact, receive a room located where others were... right beside the elevator... perhaps this is the practice, maybe these are the smallest rooms (?) but I have a very strong feeling that if, in fact, I was disappointed in the room and had expressed this to the front desk, we would have been relocated.
The front desk staff were absolutely wonderful. Upon arrival, a very nice woman greeted us, checked us in, and made sure we had trolley maps and info on the area. There were drinks and chocolate-covered strawberries for guests.
Our room was very small...but the website lists square footage of each room, so it is not something they try to conceal... Despite the size, the room was very clean and the bathroom was well-appointed...with the most wonderful shower head in the shower/tub and several "extras" along with the standard soaps, shampoo, etc... (shower cap, cotton swabs, cotton facial pads)
I did miss having a refrigerator in the room---rarely use the microwave so frequently included---but did miss the fridge... They are available in the bigger rooms, however.
The beds were firm (I'm a soft bed fan but the yummy sheets made up for the firm mattress) and I have become quite attached to a fabulous blanket that was an "extra" located on a shelf under the television.
Hopefully tomorrow we will visit the top of the building to enjoy the view...so far, weather has not allowed it...
We ordered room service and everything was delicious... Cynthia from the front desk made a special request for me to have the crispy creme brulee delivered to our room even though it was not "in room dining" but restaurant only and it was the best ever... We had cocktails our first night in the hotel and room service the second. Be sure and eat at Eighty3 if possible and have either the blueberry bread pudding or the crispy creme brulee... wonderful...
We enjoyed the complimentary turn-down service at night and the chocolates on our pillows... also enjoyed ice in the ice bucket when we returned to our room... (reminded me of being on a cruise!)
I wish we did not have to leave tomorrow... and I wish the weather had been warmer... but, that's just more motivation to return, I suppose!
I do think I would like to experience a bigger room in the hotel, although I'm not sure it's feasible for stays that have you out of the room more than in it...
Between the Madison and the Peabody, aside from the size of our room, the Madison tops in all categories... I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone.. and you can always walk over to the Peabody and enjoy the lobby and see the ducks... but then you can return to the Madison and to friendly people like Cynthia, have a complimentary chocolate strawberry & a mimosa and cuddle up in your room...

You'll get your tacos faster than you can say horchata and bursting with flavor. My favorite is the al pastor...anything...fries, tacos, etc. If it has the al pastor, I'm down. Their horchata is hit or miss. Sometimes it's too sweet

Finnish Metso Paper has won an order to supply an uncoated fine paper machine to MCC Paper Yinhe, in China.

Love, love, love, love Blueberry Hill!! This is a must any time I am in Vegas. The most amazing chicken fried steak and country gravy (white like it's supposed to be) and fantastic pancakes. At one time they also had some killer biscuits but somewhere along the way they've changed the recipe and they taste like straight lard now. \n\nWe don't even bother with casino breakfast or eating on the strip.... we get up early to eat breakfast here. Honestly, if you've never been here for breakfast you should really try it. I can't speak for lunch or dinner but I can tell you that the breakfast is excellent!

Great Customer Service!
Love this product. But after about 7 months of normal usage, it started to have connection issue and not charging properly. Kinda disappointed. I thought it could last longer. When charging iPad Pro, the end that connects to iPad turns hot. Not sure if it happens to any iPad. At least it does not turn hot when charging iPhone. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update: Anker Customer service recently contacted me after they saw my review and reached out to me. They acknowledged the one I got might be defected, and they sent me a newer version to try out. It definitely looks a lot more sturdy than the previous one. And it works! Love it!

Stronger than I thought so I have adapted the dosage for my needs. You will have to test it for yourself. To much puts me to sleep. I use it a lot at bedtime. Directions say to turn the top one way to open, but my bottle opens the other way. It took me 4 days trying to open the bottle until I tried the other way. I will probably purchase again.

We did the Philly Overnight Hotel package for the King Tut exhibit at the Franklin Institute. We had such an enjoyable time and what made the experience even better was our stay at the Loews. Let me first say that the staff at the Lowes was super nice and helpful. They understand the term ‚Äúgreat customer services‚Äù. The hotel it self is beautiful with the marbles floors. Our room was even more beautiful with the flat screen TV and nice comfortable king size bed. Not to mention our view of Philadelphia was stunning. The hotel sits in the middle of downtown so you are near everything‚Ä¶.restaurants, stores, theaters, lounges, etc‚Ä¶So close that you can choose to walk or take a cab. Worth every penny.

Bought a hopelessly underpowered PC from a well-known US web-based company. Decided that more memory might solve the problem, so replaced the 4gb of RAM with 32gb of RAM. Took quite a few attempts to properly seat the memory, and to get the PC to recognise it, but got there in the end.
It's now the fastest PC I've ever owned!! Might even consider upgrading to Windows 11, as I have so much spare capacity.
Delivery was fast, the price was reasonable, and I'm a very happy customer.

Super convenient to the airport and unique building. Very tranquil inside lobby and atrium area. Super large King room with tons of space, large desk, couch and chair. We had an interior view of the lobby. Nice bathroom with two outlets - one on each side of the sink - great hairdryer and water pressure! Loved that there was a full length mirror and a half mirror with plug under it...bed was super comfortable. Room service was very good and fast! Room was very clean - love the large plush towels - never heard much hall noise. Breakfast buffet was awesome for the money - great oatmeal and made to order omelet! Only complaint was that the tv was smaller than preferred and it was very hard to change channels from the bed which is right in front of the bed. Other than that we loved it!
The portion is ok with nice fried bihun

To visit my family, I now have to use a hotel (they don't have the energy to put us up). Thought of B&B's, but found an advance purchase with Expedia at the Hyatt to be even cheaper. Great hotel, great location and views, really nice room (just don't get one overlooking I-95 unless you have earplugs). So the room rate was great (about $120) but parking is $30 and meals are expensive. For breakfast use the little snack place for a bagel and cream cheese, otherwise breakfast will be over $20. The pool is fabulous and the fitness room is terrific. But get to know Chris the concierge - he got us into the Chart House restaurant next door at Easter with a good table and special dessert when it was full. Great service, thanks Chris!

As a big Dostoyevsky fan, I had always been disappointed with Hollywood's halfhearted attempts to get into the Russian romantic aesthetic -- case in point, Yul Brynner as Dmitri Karamazov. I had thought the whole problem was a poor casting decisions, but then I saw Yul as Major Surov and changed my mind. When given an intelligent script to work with, he suddenly came alive and was as noble, sexy, and conflicted as you could ever want a Neurotic Russian Officer to be! So he was a better Dmitri as Major Surov than he was as Dmitri. But that's because writer Tabori actually gave Yul, as the Conflicted Russian Officer, the kind of Conflicted Russian Officer lines that are worthy of real literature, and that have real meaning and pathos in them. For example, a propos of folk music, he says musingly, "You hear a man crying in the dark. And if you listen carefully enough, you know what he cries for. You look surprised, Lady Ashmore. Despite what you may have heard, tractors and Marxism aren't the only things the Russian cares for. There is always time for music."Brilliant!!

Don't pay any attention to the previous negative comments. They are unfounded or perhaps it was a different Hotel Adagio. My wife and I stayed here in February of 2004 for my 40th birthday and enjoyed every minute of our stay at the Hotel Adagio. To put this into proper perspective I travel frequently for work and stay at some of the best hotels in the country such as the Soho Grand and Le Parker Meridian in NYC as well as the Mondrian and Shutters in L.A. We chose the Adagio after considering several others such as the Clift (which is across the the street), the Rex and the Monaco. We could not have been happier with our choice. The Hotel Adagio ranks up there with all of them in terms of accomodations and helpfulness of staff. Upon arrival we were asked if we would like to upgrade to a suite for a mere $25 extra per night. What a bargain. The hotel compares to any of the Phillip Stark designed hotels, however, without all the attitude. After a long day of sightseeing and shopping we looked forward to returning to the Adagio for a couple glasses of wine at the stylish (albeit beautiful people scene) bar and then relaxing in our room. If I were returning to San Francisco tomorrow I would stay at the Hotel Adagio in a heartbeat. Do yourself a favor and stay at this wonderful hotel.

Let's get this party started. 

It's been my good fortune to have a few opportunities to drop in on Madison this past year, marvelling at the miracle of the farmer's market with its 20,000 people genially all walking in the same direction and had great dinners and drinks at Nostrano, Merchant and Graze and great meats and cheeses from Fromagination. 

A friend more familiar with the scene than me learned I was heading through again and alerted me that The Underground Food Collective had just opened a butcher shop and it sounded fabulous. 

It's fabulous. I stopped in last night and assembled a hotel room charcuterie plate for the ages - soft and bursting-with-fresh-fennel-flavor Finocchiona (sorry for the alliteration), Culatello (!) - lush and sweet with a just-right note of Funk, a 16 month Gouda and a country baguette as good as any I've ever had. The meat case was laden with sausage, poultry and beautiful cuts that made me wish my hotel would let me into the kitchen. 

Wanted to make it back on my way back to Chicago today for a housemade Hot Dog with Kimchi and to load up on fresh sausage but couldn't quite swing it. 

The owners are recent Chicago transplants who were probably eager to ply their trade in a supportive state and a city free of both Aldermen and abundant extra regulations. Their pickled product - displayed but not able to be sold - looked equally fantastic and the space is raw, gorgeous and not overly-styled. 

They are Good Kids. If you're fortunate enough to live in Madison go support them. I'll be back, with a cooler. 

Also check out the Collective's social media and videos. Funny, sincere, useful - Good stuff. Fight the Good Fight.

I traveled to San Francisco recently with my sister and best friend to celebrate my completion of chemotherapy treatment. Based on reviews we found at TripAdvisor we booked a suite at the Columbus Motor Inn. What a find! The location at the edge of North Beach was terrific, the rooms were clean and nicely furnished and the free parking was awesome. The staff member at the front desk was very helpful with recommendations for dining within walking distance, directions, etc. I will definitely stay here again

I just moved around the corner from Nevada Nails & Spa from Texas and I was looking for a quick mani/pedi before I started training for work. I was lucky because I just walked in and Yen was available. I instantly fell in love with her and I got so much more then that. Although I was tired from my move we talked the entire time and she made me feel right at home. 

The nail salon is clean, the chairs are nice and comfy and the prices are very affordable.

Today when I called last minute Yen said she could take me and thank God she did because I needed someone to turn my day around and she was so sweet and allowed me to just sit back and relax. She also helped me pick out my colors and I can't stop showing them off to boyfriend, I love the PINK! Thank you Yen, I cannot say enough amazing things about you, I wish you and your family all the blessings in the world and I can't wait to come back and see you in a few weeks.

This was the first time I visited San Francisco and enjoyed my stay at Hotel Whitcomb. The staff was friendly and helpful whenever I asked for places to visit. Though the hotel is an older hotel, it still has kept its originaity, especially in the lobby area. My room was on the 5th floor, it was nicely equipped and clean with a great view of the city. It is centrally locationed with public transport within a few minutes of walking distance. All sights are within easy reach. All the amenities that I needed for my business were available at the hotel. I would definitely come back to this hotel for my next business trip. Keep up the great work and see you in a few months.

This is undoubtedly one of the funniest movies ever made. Amitabh as a country bumpkin, Arjun Singh, is hilarious. The best thing is the laughter never stops. The plot is a same-old same-old story where child is separated from mother who sacrifices everything for her duty - with a happy reunion at the end. There are villains (Ranjit) and there are brothers (Sashi Kapoor) and there are vixens (Parveen Babhi) and there are lovers (Smita Patil) and there is a blind brother and a grandfather thrown in for good measure. But this movie is about Amitabh and thats all you remember at then end.Amitabh comes to the city to make a decent living and his dialogue delivery and mannerisms are hilarious. Later in the movie he turns into the Angry Young Man he is famous for but the humour stays. Memorable parts include his walking, talking and speaking english, the song (pad gungaroo re bhand, meera nachi thi) and everything with his dadoo.All in all I was rolling with laughter throughout the movie. If you want 3 hours of entertainment with Amitabh at his absolute best - this is it. It will easily give it a 10/10.

Good Location and Nice Rooms
I stayed here for a few nights on a business trip in September 2012. The hotel is in a great location, next to China Town and Little Italy. The rooms are spacious, modern, and clean. Perfectly setup for business and pleasure.
There can be some noise coming in from the street if you're staying on the lower floors so they hook you up with ear plugs. I stayed on the 9th floor and did not need to use them.
Unfortunately I did not have time to check out the hotel amenities such as the lobby bar (I think they have two) or the fitness facility.
The only issue I had with the hotel was the front desk staff. They were very nice but not knowledgeable. They did allow me to check in super early at 10am but here is the downside. My company called in several times to pay for the room but yet they could not figure it out. It took a fourth try to get it right. It was a bit annoying. Also, they had no clue about the internet available in the rooms. At least the person I talked to did not. They have both wi-fi and ethernet (hardwire) for those with the same question I did.
I would give them a 4 star but making a 3 because of the paying issue.
Battery delivered super fast. Fitted to car and all problems resolved.

I'm a fan of well-done, simple, no-frills burgers, and Smashburger is just that. A co-worker and I just came back from a wonderful lunch and I'm completely satisfied. I opted to build my own burger and went with a 1/2lb. burger on the chipotle bun with cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, ketchup, mustard, and chipotle sauce. I'm not a fan of a lot of spices on my fries so I went with the regular. A cold cherry coke made my meal complete. I was told it would be 5-7 minutes before my order was ready, and not more than five minutes later, it was brought out to our table. Not only was the presentation really nice, but the burger was out of this world! It was cooked just as I like it (well-done) and was really hot and juicy. The fries were good on their own, but paired with the chipotle sauce, they were near perfect. The awesome food coupled with the friendly, efficient service ranks Smashburger up in my top three favorite burgers in town. Well done!

While my kids enjoyed the movie (and announced afterward that they want to buy it later) I think I got more out of it that they did. The scene in the airport shop at the beginning is real life (I did not use the cutting comment aloud, but I thought it). It is a feel good mid-life movie, a bit sappy and some scenes work less well than others (why does the kid stay with Bruce Willis after he knows his Mom is dying?), but all in all and good time. It also gave our family something to talk about - did my kids think my life was boring? What do they expect at 40? How can you not like a movie that gets a good conversation going with your kids?

I was in Phoenix for business and decided to stay at this property. This hotel is very convenient for all types of travellers. The bathrooms are a bit dated, but the rest of the room is well appointed with the usual modern fare: flat screen TV, WiFi, alarm, desk, table, etc. What always gets me in most hotels is a lack of electrical outlets by the bed. I called reception and a surge protector was brought up for me right away. Wonderful service.
Another characteristic that I liked was the option not to have your room made up everyday. If you do not wish for formal housekeeping, then you have an option of getting 500 Starwood points or $5 dollars in food credit for the hotel. As I am not a slob, and not such a stickler if my room is not made up, I opted for the Starwood points.
The staff is friendly and welcoming. I would be happy to stay at this property again.
Expensive compared to a normal meal but a nice variety of local food in a lively setting. Definitely worth it if you're hungry and have friends to introduce to Malay cuisine.

I stayed at the intercontinental SFO on a business trip in January- hotel is conveniently located downtown within reasonable walking distance to the waterfront, Chinatown, and just a block from the Moscone West convention center. I had a room on the 28th floor with a FANTASTIC view of the city. Rooms are clean and nicely appointed- bed was very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and allowed me to check in early. There is a gym on the 6th floor that is open 24h which is very convenient, and provides water and fruit as well. The lobby bar is a nice meeting spot (try the Italian mojito) but if you really want to be blown away, head to the View bar on the 39th floor of the Marriott (a couple blocks away)!

You have a macdonalds across from you and also a starbucks and a TGI fridays. Request a high floor as you will get a excellent view we was on the 37th floor and it was great. All in all the hotel and the trip was fantastic could not complain at all would return to this to this hotel.

Amazingly delicious. Hands down a 5. The food is soooo good. The menu isn't very descriptive but it doesn't need to be the food speaks for itself. The service was fantastic also. We shared the veal, duck in a can, tartare and boar rib - wow. Duck in a can is quite an experience haha they just open the can of their duck breast with foie gras and this delicious sauce and pour it over cauliflower pur\u00e9e.. I mean there are just no words honestly. The veal was probably my favorite it was seasoned to perfection. They also just opened a food truck so keep an eye out for that one. \n\nIf you are in Montreal you absolutely cannot miss this one.

We came for dinner just before 6 on a Thursday. I had noticed they had happy hour until 6, but the hostess informed us this was only at the bar. We could have saved a few $$ if we had just done that, but honestly the food was so good I didn't feel bad paying more. 

Bread was brought to our table and served with a pesto dipping sauce - I ate the remainder of the sauce with my hands it was so good.

We ordered the Mediterranean salad and piccante flatbread. I also ordered a red sangria - which was different from normal sangria since it had crushed berries it it - but it was one of the best sangrias I've ever had. The salad and flatbread were delicious. The salad was big and worth the price - flatbread was good but maybe a better deal on the happy hour menu since it was smaller than expected. 

The food was the perfect portion so we still had room for dessert. We decided on the coconut cakes with blood orange sorbet. This is probably gross but I honestly did not want to swallow my cake - I kept it in my mouth like a fine red wine and savored every last piece. 

This restaurant needs to come to Chicago - I would be all over it like white on rice.

Lovely restaurant, nicely laid out, unusual serving dishes(leaves and fish shapes). Staff were fantastic - described unfamiliar dishes really well. Not as cheap as other places in Central Market but worth the extra cost. Try the starter selection to share.

This hotel is quite nice. The service is excellent. They immediately gave us razors and shaving cream when we asked for them.
Environment is nice and the large atrium and Southwest/Northern Mexico decor makes for a comfortable place.
The breakfast is nice and ample for American style breakfasts, including a full array of hot foods, fruits, yogurts and an expresso machine.
The exercise room is average, has all the nautical machines and treadmills, but kind of small for the size of the hotel.
The only potential drawback is location, which is convenient if you can drive there, but not if you're hoping to take public transportation or walk.

Just returned from a weekend at the Philadelphia Marriott Downtown. The hotel is very impressive. When we drove up, there were multiple car attendants to greet us, quickly remove our bags and get us to the front desk for check in. The check in was quite seamless and the staff were very kind, considerate, warm and caring. By the time I receive my keys, I was already quite excited about being at this amazing hotel. The lobby is exciting and convenient having concierge services, a Fedex, a Starbucks and a restaurant and shopping all within the hotel. The hotel has recently had a renovation and our room felt quite new with nice bathroom amenities, very comfortable bedding and state of the art televisions. When we called "At Your Service" to request a hypoallergenic pillow for my wife, it was brought instantly and with a smile. What is further amazing about this hotel is its unbelievable location. I was able to walk easily to Rittenhouse Square, to the theatre to see "the Buddy Holly Story", to all of the shopping, restaurants and sightseeing that I wanted to do. The hotel is right next to the Reading Market, the Convention Center and is very near the beautiful shopping areas. This is a hotel that I felt when I left that I was truly feeling at home. Cannot wait to return!!!
Love d ambience n food here..Live music can make u sit there for hours..Good service n pick your table early on weekends..Must visit..

This hotel is absolutely the best value for the price that I have ever found. The location is absolutely perfect (especially if you find the little walkway that connects the street it is on with the Hollywood/Highland complex...a little hidden, but once found, makes an extremely short walk even shorter). The staff is excellent and always ready to help (and call someone to find an answer if they don't know it personally). The breakfast, while small as some other reviews have stated, is delicious and enough to keep you going (with all the great restaurants in LA, why would you want to stuff yourself on a huge continental breakfast anyways?) Parking can be a bit of a struggle, but at least it is free instead of $20/night like at other nearby hotels (Tip: if coming in in the middle of the day when the lot is a little less crowded, turn around and back in, makes getting out next time MUCH easier). The decor in the rooms is very cute. I can't find a single thing to complain about. Wonderful,
would recommend to almost anyone (though I'm not sure about handicap access, didn't see any ramps or level entrances anywhere). Definitely will stay here again the next time I'm lucky enough to return to LA.

I booked this hotel for a total of eight days in mid-to-late June when I needed to come to Chicago for an operation. The room they gave me (twice - on either side of the surgery) was large and clean; it had both a refrigerator and a microwave. The bathroom alone was larger than some hotel rooms I have stayed in. Everything worked properly and the bed was comfortable (important for a recuperating surgical patient). The staff were friendly and informative. There is wireless internet capability in the rooms and a dedicated terminal in the lobby for those who need web access but don't have a laptop. There were perhaps five restaurants and three stores very nearby (one to two blocks), and Chicago's metro rail system was accessible a block away. I don't know how anyone could rate this a bad hotel; my stay was wonderful, and I'll definitely book again if ever need to go back to Chicago. By the way, the Hilton is about two blocks away - in the "bad direction" - and their prices were $ignificantly higher... I highly recommend the Travelodge.

Comfortable, attentive and great food.
The in flight entertainment was good and the range was good.
I arrived rested and hydrated which for an overnight flight is uncommon. The cabin could not be better.

Purchased a cheap ticket and the baggage was included. Flight was delayed by two hours, which was not what we expected, but the almost 5 hour flight to Bishkek was nice and safe. There is no entertainment, but the sandwich we got was very tasty. Drinks only water and tea, but ok. The plane was clean, the flight safe, the crew was professional but did not look very happy. All in all, recommended, but as it seems they have a record of delays, perhaps if using them one needs a plan B in case the flight is late.

Stayed here for two nights with my wife and granddaughter. We were given a room with a view of the bay and a peak of Alcatraz. We arrived and were greeted politely by the doorman. The lobby was large, clean and the front desk staff was excellent.
We were assigned a room with a king and used a rollaway for the GD. They offered us two full's but I said I would kill my wife if we had to sleep on such a small bed.
Three elevators and they all worked. Clean halls, newer hallway carpets and well lit.
Our room was clean overlooked California Street with its cable car line. Yes it is a little noisy but you are in the city. If you want a quieter room get one of the interior rooms they will be very quite but you will not have a view unless the guest across the way is cute.
Rooms in SF are small. We were OK with the rollaway but it was a little snug. The tub and toilet are in a separate area off the main bathroom but I didn't like the louvered door separating the sink and closet area with the main room. It should be a solid door.
The shower had great pressure but if you are any taller than 5-8 (me) it is very low. It looked like they ran out of pipe or made a big mistake on measuring. But it worked well and I got along.
The rooms were clean, well lit, updated and quite expect for the exterior noise.
We used the club lounge several times. They served breakfast with eggs, oatmeal, various fruits and pastries. Good coffee and OJ. They have yogurt and milk, sodas, water available all day. At night they had a cold plate, desserts etc. We get free access so this feature saved us a few $ at breakfast.
PARKING IS OUTRAGOUSE IN SF. 52.00 per night 6 of that is taxes. It is expensive all over town and you will be very lucky to find a street park. I saw parking rates from 6.00 to 9.00 per hour. So be prepared. There were cheaper places to park about two blocks away but that lacks convenience and on rainy days not very fun.
This was a good hotel overall. At the top of Nob Hill so you are not in the hustle of Union Square where some of the other Marriott's are.

Hotel Stay: Staff was friendly. Check-in was efficient, after a short wait in line. I'm usually not an early morning person and so appreciated the comfortable bed and a good night's sleep. Check-out was without a hassle - After picking up the bill/receipt slipped underneath our door, we just called down to the front desk to check out.

Very cool hotel. Very nice lobby, stylish and hip. One thing to remember is that most of the hotels that are located in the Union Square area are very old which means very small rooms and small bathrooms. So if you want a big room and big bathroom good luck at that in this area. So with that said, the room was decorated very nice and modern along with the bathroom but they are quiet small. Another thing too is that no matter what time of day or night this area is noisy and you can hear it from your rooms no matter what floor your on. The Redwood Bar downstairs was very nice to have a drink, Friday and Saturday is was full with lots of hipsters. I did not get to eat at their restaurant. We got lucky and paid only $120 a night for the rooms on a Cheap O Air website. I would say that if I had to pay the normal rate for this room I would be a little pissed since like I said the rooms are quiet small.

We ordered rice with ostrich rolls (superb!), honey stout chicken (tasty!), and crispy mani chai (super addictive!).I cannot find ANY fault with this place. Some people say that it's pricier here comparatively, but once you see the portion I would say that it's well justified! If you could get Alison to serve your table, he's great! We had a very specific need for an exterior door. 

Several Home Depot competitors were unable to fulfill that need. However, Home Depot had sales people that worked to find a custom solution. 

Then upon the arrival of the door, much more that the usual effort was needed before the door could be installed. The installer was an excellent person, his work was precise, and he cleaned up the materials left after the work was completed.

All this for a price that was more than competitive.

Than you all for your efforts.

Growing up, I always swore I would never become my mother -- meaning I would never go gaga over kitchen appliances, gadgets and coffee makers... well, never say never. I'm exactly like her! I absolutely LOVE Sur La Table and can spend hours in here looking at gadgets, pots, pans, and baking supplies; not to mention their high-tech coffee makers that make that perfect cup of delectable decadence coffee sure to please your taste buds. \n\nThe staff at the Kierland location are superb as well. They are extremely attentive to your needs and allow you to try out coffee machines before you buy (secretly though, they do it to get you hyped up on caffeine so you'll be so excited about the coffee, you'll forget about the price). Sur La Table also offers cooking classes which is a great bonus; not only do they sell kitchen gadgets, they show you how to use them (which let's be honest, some of those gadgets look like they're from the future).

From the moment we pulled up we were pleased with what we saw. Great shopping right up the street. The staff was very welcoming.
Hazel checked us in and was very pleasant. When we got to our room I was a little surprised by what I saw. We didn't have a full length mirror and I couldn't find a plug in the bathroom. On our way out I asked Hazel her thoughts on a place we were headed and then mentioned my bewilderment on the lack of mirror and plug. She immediately gave us a new room ( and a much nicer one).
When booking be specific, floor number? Sleep number bed or not? Full length mirror?

Wow...this custard really does live up to the hype. I got the pineapple flavor today without any toppings or extras and I was blown away. I have had my share of custard from places in the Bay Area and this one really surprised me in terms of how creamy and rich it is without making my stomach feel like I ate a pound of cream or butter. 

I'm not sure if the location near the OG is helpful or not but it certainly can't hurt to have tasty custard only a couple of footsteps away from their establishment.

Note: there were actual pieces of pineapple in the custard which was really a treat. 

Will be back when I come back to LV!

Best buffet in Vegas as of August 2014. 

Asian section is kind of tucked away in the back but once you find it there's sushi, noodle soups in different varieties, dim sum and other yummy dishes. 
Meat section, as I called it but I think properly it was the American section, served a carving station with all the meat you could ask for, tons of potato dishes (my fave was the truffled potatoes), even a quinoa dish, although it didn't taste particularly healthy.

Bottomless Mimosas were great but dangerous. 

Tips
* Stay awhile and enjoy dessert too. Green tea creme brulee was awesome!
* Asian section is in the back (#minoritycorner)
* Truffled potatoes = must try
* Stop by the noodle station

"Pixote: A Lei do Mais Fraco" deals with what is perhaps the greatest of all Brazilian themes: poverty. And along with poverty the other unnatural feelings and actions it brings; prostitution, violence, crime, rape and murder.Brazil is the country of paradoxes, and its social problems are present everywhere. The difference between the rich and the poor; the beautiful and the ugly; happiness and the most profound human decay."Pixote" is one of the films that dare to touch and open these so painful wounds, and does it without the slightest glimmer of hope, in an honest portrayal of a country that, like Pixote himself, is already lost.
The Chicken, the Ribs the Salmon Salad the Sides!!! üòãI can go on .... Everything is Scrumptious!!

The working title was: "Don't Spank Baby". Wayne Crawford went on to become a successful producer, films like Valley Girl, Night of the Comet and others, even though he wasn't too terrific in this little Gem. And little known Abe Zwick should have gotten tons of work from this film but didn't. Filmed at Moberly Studios in Hollywood Florida, on the same lot the early Tarzan movies were filmed. This film is definitely for those who appreciate the abstract. The movie was originally shot with some nudity and much more graphic slasher scenes. For reasons only known to Tom Casey the Director, the bloody slasher scenes were given a tab of LSD, and the nudity was removed. Even though this version is worthy of a look for those so inclined, in my opinion, the original version would have packed the punch needed to make this a full on Slasher 70's Cult Classic.

I was delighted with my sleek but comfy hotel room. Clean lines. Good bed. Modern upgraded bathroom with nice faucets. The fruit bowl on the gorgeous Saarinen end table made my day.
But then bedtime came, and I noticed two very important things that hadn't mattered until then. The room has shudders not curtains, which means a ton of light comes through. No problem: I have an eye shade in my travel bag. But the second problem's major: There is non-stop truck and other traffic on the street below the window, and the windows offer absolutely no sound blocking at all. I live in NYC so am used to street noise, but I woke up continuously through the night and am dragging today because of it.
The hotel management should know that there are sound blocking windows that should be installed above busy streets. I was on a high floor, so I can't even imagine how bad the noise would be on the low floors. If the hotel has interior rooms, you should ask for one.

Sometimes it is difficult to get a good hotel in a big city even at a higher price.. but Hotel Andra is a great find in Seattle. Location is perfect, not crazy expensive, rooms immaculate, lovely lobby and bar area,& staff very friendly and helpful.. what more could you ask. A couple of odd things to note though.. 1. as in lots of cities valet is expensive at 39$ so try to make sure you include that in the final hotel average rate.. I thought I did and after calling them direct and then receiving an email confirmation with the final rate they told me something different when it came to check out and paying. I sent them my email with my he confirmed rates later on but they did not honour it so as it was only 50 $ and it was a great hotel I left it alone. 2. You have to pay $10/day for wireless.. in this day and age and for this type of hotel it seems odd to me.

There are absolutely NO words to describe how BEAUTIFUL this hotel is! From when you walk into the lobby you are greeted with professionalism & class! We were offered free hot chocolate and free wi-fi while we waited for our check-in in the sleek lobby. We went on a short sightsee of the hotel and sipped on cocktails at the surprisingly HUGE full bar! There is also a full restaurant to suffice an appitite you may have. When we arrived to the 20th floor of our room the view itself was remarkable!! I recommend getting the city view which is a room in the corner of the hotel where you can view the breathtaking sights of the city with the Bay Bridge as the backdrop! From the flat screen television to the most comfortable bed I've EVER slept on, it's the hotel you HAVE to be in when you come to San Francisco! - Sia D.
Cozy restaurant

We recently stayed at the hotel after booking the night on a third party website. The central location makes up for much grief but be warned about the mixed bag of rooms they have. We arrived at 6 PM to a very busy hotel (lobby was full of Irish people, probably on their Christmas shopping trip to NYC) and my wife checked us in. Unfortunately we must have gotten one of the last open room which was a.) by itself in a separate walkway next to the elevator shaft, b.) next to the vending machine and ice maker, and c.) very small with an equally small window to the outside. Looking out of the window on the 28th floor one could see....another set of room windows in the next facade of the hotel about 20 feet away (close curtain for privacy!).
Should have changed rooms right there and then but did not, so we had to endure the procession of people to the ice maker for the next 5 or so hours - and those room doors are paper-thin. The room itself was, as others described, pretty bar bones with no mini-bar and generally only "Holiday-Inn" like decor and furniture/accessories. Strange enough the TV signal was very weak so the picture of the TV was grainy and somewhat blurry.
I have had some bad hotel rooms in New York and this one was not the worst, but given the grand name of the hotel and the standard room rate this was underwhelming. Next time I would ask to be moved to another room. Glad I did not pay full price for the hotel.
Good app, love the discount.

Good for the price
Really good for the price wish it was a little more noticeable but ill take it for the price.

The IPA is exceptional. Visiting from Charlotte, I was curious about the brewing seen up here. Fellow PITT alumni Matt was working the tap room with finesse and kept everyone's glasses full and conversations going!! Killer IPA so I left with a growler to remember where to grab beer when I visit the Burgh!! HAIL TO PITT!!

This girl has Happy Feet! I went in for a color change, green of course to get a little lucky & to celebrate this month's holiday St Patrick's day! Tom as always the pedicure extraordinare did an awesome paint job & a toe nail touch up! He suggested a base coat color to go under the glittery green I chose, hey a girl needs some flare, even there! They look fabulous, I'd show them but my toes are camera shy! If you live way out East stop by US Nails & ask for Tom, he'll give you happy feet too! :)

Stayed at the Strand in April this year and was extremely happy with this hotel. The rooms were lovely, small but lovely.
The service was exceptional. A bottle of red wine was delivered our first night to thank us for staying at the hotel.
The hotel is so central. We walked to central park, close to the shops and close to the subway to go downtown.
The rooftop bar is amazing. great New York atmosphere. Great cocktails.
Definatly give this hotel a try. It was nice to come back to this hotel after long days wandering around the city.

The Bobbie is one of the greatest meat sandwiches ever created. You got turkey, mayo and cranberry sauce on a giant roll. I don't think I have ever ordered anything else from there! That's how Double Bomb the sandwich is!

Food is good
And service too. Waitresses are courteous and helpful .
I'm a regular and will recommend my friends to come
Food edible

I hope I will be just as satisfied as I was this time. It was my first time at the Hotel Newton and I selected the location to be near my granddaughter's school which was just a couple of blocks away. My daughter and granddaughter stayed with me so I was a solo traveler but a hotel guest with a family.
The hotel exceeded my expectations in almost every respect. The staff was super professional and attentive. The room was very clean and comfortable, for the most part. My only complaints are 1) the radiator heat can not be controlled by guests and 2) the television had white vertical lines always present. With respect to the room temperature, we were so thankful we could open the window but that, of course, allowed more street noise in. My daughter retrieved a fan from home and we were able to use that for circulation and "white noise" for the rest of our stay (5 nights total) but most people will not have that option. As far as the television goes, it was certainly tolerable and most folks will not be holed up in their room watching it. We were told that all television sets in the hotel had the lines (see photo).
Yes, the elevator is slow but I've experienced worse in Europe. Since we were on the second floor we usually took the stairs. We paid $5 a day for internet - - free would have been nice but no big deal. I booked my room through booking.com and missed a great deal offered by the hotel. I probably should have realized that after the holidays something like that might have been available.
The neighborhood had everything we needed and I felt totally safe moving around on my own. Unfortunately, my granddaughter became ill while we were there but even that was manageable with an urgent care location a couple of blocks away and a drug store next door. Central Park is located just a few blocks to the east and a major subway station just steps away.
I would absolutely stay at the Hotel Newton again.

I have been going to this salon for the past ten years. I love everything about the salon, the workers, the environment and the cleanliness. Everyone is so so friendly. I have been getting my nails done with Kevin for the past 10 years and he is one of the best i've ever been to and he doesn't rush when doing your nails and makes them absolutely perfect and flawless. If I have ever broken a nail or chipped it or anything they fix it right away for free. \nI have also been going to Jenny for my pedicures and brow waxes and she is also amazing and makes my brows exactly how I want it. I've also been to Anthony, Lisa and Tina and my services with them have been nothing but amazing doing exactly what I want. My sister and three nieces go to this salon and I wouldn't ever think about going anywhere else. I don't trust anywhere else with my nails.
Investors could have a rare opportunity to buy Amazon while it's down significantly.
Really awesome place

I must admit I have a thing for Outback. But this Outback is something special...

Their interior has been remodeled within the last couple of years and it looks unlike any I've seen before. It's absolutely delightful! There are new designs and murals on the wall, and neat dividers between booths. The bar looks wonderful and the table tops are shiny and new. There are all new wooden floors too. This place got an overhaul and looks great!

Our server was a new girl who had been there a few months, and she did a pretty good job. I had the spinach artichoke chicken flatbread pizza as an "aussie-tizer" and it was AMAZING! It's only available for a limited time and I highly recommend you get to try it while they have it! There is an awesome happy hour that spans as long as their open, "billabong hours" they call it. In Australia a billabong is a watering hole, and so at the Outback the bar is their billabong. Their small draft domestic beers are only $1.95 and the house wine is only $2.50 a glass. I know right? Awesome!

The food was outstanding as ever, 10 oz Strips are delicious and the perfect size. And to top it off with a chocolate thunder from down under was the icing on the cake! This place is just legit from top to bottom.

On a side note, the manager there, Scott Hughes, is an amazing guy. I've met him a few times and he's always so incredibly cordial. He is the essence of hospitality and customer service. He is always walking around talking with guests ensuring everyone is doing great in his establishment. He really takes pride in his work, which is so rare to see nowadays in the restaurant industry. This guy is great at what he does and I'm glad I know him.

If you're in the neighborhood by Superstition Mall I highly recommend going to this place. It's got great food, great people working, and great management! Woohoo! This is as good as it gets!

Okay for price
Okay for price. Smaller than I thought.

Let me start by saying I am from San Diego, and we have an array of excellent, high class cigar bars to choose from. With that said, Fox's takes the cake as the best cigar bar I have ever been to. \nThe scotch/whisky/bourbon selection is nothing short of a masterpiece, with something for spirits lovers of all levels (at very competitive prices).\n The cigar selection is great, with highly knowledgeable staff who cater to your palate. If you're in the area, definitely check this place out and be sure to talk to Rachel (our server who was very helpful when choosing drinks), Kyle (Fox's personal cigar aficionado), and Cliff (the GM who took care of us incredibly well by going the extra mile on everything).

Quality product
The Carhartt brand makes good heavy duty products. The cotton is thick and high quality. Runs a little bit large in size. Shrinks a little in the dryer.

Stopped by during CES. Banger Brewing is a great addition to downtown. Great Beer and a super friendly staff. Loved the 5 beer sampler with locally made flavored popcorn. I think the IPA was my favorite but all the beer was good or unique. Anyone visiting Vegas who wants to get away from the Strip and experience something more genuine, head down to Banger Brewing and get the sampler. They don't serve food but another cool new downtown addition called the Container Park has some good choices and its only a block away. I'll be back next year.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring. The absurdity of the goings-on, the thick Australian accents and the bizarre set of characters all help to ensure that the film entertains also. The plot follows the story of a young doorman who thinks he'll go on to bigger things after accepting a job from the local kingpin. He doesn't; the job only lands him in trouble when he fancies a swim and stupidly leaves ten grand on the beach, which is promptly stolen by a couple of kids who have the time of their lives on a shopping spree. However, all is not rosy for our hero; who must find the money or face the consequences...The film is made up of a cast of unknowns; at least, it was back in 1999, as nowadays Heath Ledger is something of a name. He doesn't impress too much here, however, as his performance is mostly of the one-note variety and he doesn't make for a very compelling lead. He fits the movie in that he's Australian and looks naive; but beyond that, he's not the best lead I've ever seen in a movie. If you ask me, Bryan Brown gave the best performance here. He might not have a great deal of screen time, but he steals every scene he's in and it's him that provides the movie with a lot of its humour. He's got nothing to do with the best sequence, however, which takes place in the form of probably the most hilarious bank robbery ever caught on film. On the whole, I can recommend this film to people that enjoy quirky crime films; as the weirdness is plentiful, and the way that events take a turn for the bizarre is enjoyable; but if you're not a fan of this sort of film, I can't really say that Two Hands will float your boat. It's not a must see, but if it's your thing and you get a chance to see it...you probably wont completely regret it.

I had never seen such an incredible acting job in a motion picture as I did when I saw Daniel Day-Lewis play Christy Brown in My Left Foot. In fact off the scene his role wasn't even over. He played the role of Christy Brown or at least disabled like him all through the filming of the movie and needed surgery because of the damage his superior acting had done to his back. To me that is remarkable and through all the pain he put up with to act that role I believe it is quite true to say he put on the most Oscar worthy performance in history. He was so masterful in this tough a part that I believe no one could have done it better or with more of an impact than him. Although I cannot say it is the greatest movie of all time I can say that how he played this impossible a role and then kept on acting it until it wasn't even acting anymore is without a doubt the greatest feet I will ever seen an actor do. Probably a man too for that matter.

This hotel is in a good location with great WiFi, large clean room,fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a balcony with a view on the space needle. There is also a pull out couch in the room. Staff were very good with a hot breakfast served each morning. Free parking is available both on and off site. Tours pick you and drop you at the door. Bottled water and popcorn greet you on check in.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words. The tone is everything. He carries it through the action and suspense as well as the grim bits of gallows humor. I like the other two actors a great deal too. The blonde girl is totally gorgeous and the man is hysterical in his twisted tough guy stoicism. Some of the thugs seemed a little sketchy but this is a mini-point really. The film is totally solid and Franco is way cool all around.

I was in Houston this past week on business for a conference in the Galleria, an area which has quite a few Starwood properties around it. I settled on the Westin Oaks, a hotel I had stayed at previously a couple years ago that was still undergoing renovations at the time. Back then, my experience was mixed, with the elevators having a mind of their own, the older rooms looking worn out, and the service level was just a hit or miss. Could this time around be any different?
Arriving a couple hours before normal check-in time, I was informed of a room being available and had been upgraded to an Executive King Corner room on the 17th floor. The check-in experience itself was quick, and the agents at the front desk were pleasant to deal with. A couple years ago, the lobby area was only limited to the elevators and the front desk while renovations were going on and the changes were noticeable and quite nice I have to admit. The one big thing one will notice is the major improvement in the elevators, they no longer have a mind of their own and you simply enter the floor number you'd like to be taken to and off you go. The lobby bar area was available this time around, and it had a nice upscale feel to it which was rather enjoyable.
My room itself was a large corner room, with new furnishings that were very similar to other new Westin properties. The bed was indeed "heavenly", and I was impressed with the overall look and feel of the room. No longer did these rooms have that worn look to them, and it was obvious that Westin has really done a good job with the room upgrades. The corner Executive King room is very similar to a suite, and is very spacious - one will not be disappointed with it!
Throughout my three night stay, I was able to use in-room dining which was good and much better than my previous stay and the front desk was able to take care of any of my needs. Danny Ruiz, one of the guest relations coordinators had contacted me ahead of my stay asking me if there was anything I would need and made sure my stay was as enjoyable as possible. One of the best things about this hotel is that it's right in the Galleria, so you basically have the mall available to you during business hours and it's very easy to get a quick meal at the food court, walk down to a decent sit-down restaurant, or just pass the time with some shopping or even a bit of ice-skating! As my conference was in the same area, I hardly ever had the need to step outside other than going out to events in the evening. I also had a chance to experience the Business Center which helped me out greatly.
Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by this stay and it's great to see the changes that have taken place at this hotel. A couple years ago, I had the kind of experience which was OK at best and I didn't really know how this time would turn around. I'm happy to say though that this hotel has improved greatly after the renovations, and you might even think you're at a completely different place if you've stayed here before. The rooms have been upgraded and are definitely on par with the newer Westin hotels, the service level has improved greatly, and elevators I'm thrilled to say now take you to where you want to go! The staff was wonderful to deal with, and every need I had was taken care of without hesitation. It's amazing how things change after a renovation, and this property has definitely been upgraded. Other Starwood hotels exist around the area, but I'll be staying at the Westin Oaks again as my choice of hotel in Houston.

I am a senior traveler. The people at the reception desk helped me with dinner reservations, taxis, stairs and responded kindly to my every request. I would certainly choose to stay at the Ace Hotel again and would recommend it as comfortable and fun.

The hotel is in a great location and generally staff are lovely, especially John the doorman. However at over $300 a night room only (Inc taxes) for an internal facing room it seems expensive. The decor is quirky.
The hotel is great for being on the wharf and next to the cable car stop, but the wharf area is quite seedy. A couple of times I got hassled by people on the street, one very creepy.
Didn't eat in the hotel apart from breakfast, which again seemed quite expensive at about $18 for a croissant, bagel and 2 coffees, better going to the Starbucks at the back of the hotel.
The sound-proofing between the rooms is not good, I could hear the couple next door chatting through the night/woken up when they did early in the morning.
The wine hour is good and it's nice to get a chance to socialise with the other guests.
Would recommend on the basis could get a deal which would reduce price.

I am very impressed with this store! It's consistently clean and the staff have always been helpful and kind to me. In each department, I am impressed by the selection of products they have to offer. The produce department has always been well stocked for my trips, with only the exception of one occasion (due to a national lime shortage). I appreciate that there is a bank location and a Starbucks location within the store as well, not to mention a gas station with reduced fuel prices for Safeway Card holders. For the most part, the entire store is well lit and the products are almost always well stocked. Overall, I think this store deserves five stars because of the quality it consistently offers it's customers. It's no AJ's, but it's also more reasonable in price!

I stayed at the Palace Hotle in July 2011 for one night on a business trip to SF. I was immediately impressed with this hotel from the moment I met the valet. First, he complimented the move I had to make cutting across traffic to make it to the hotel, and then he was more than friendly while helping me get m bag from the trunk. A great ambassador for the hotel.
The lobby and atrium inside are beautiful. I had breakfast there in the morning (breakfast was pretty pricey- $20 for an omlette) and the waiter gave a history lesson on the hotel, which was very interesting. It was nice to see an employee with such pride in the property where he worked.
The room was nice, nothing crazy, but very clean and tastefully decorated. Nice bathroom as well.
Everything else was great, like I said, it was only one night, but I would definitely stay there again.
Quick response and excellent job done in a day thanks.

Best sushi I've had in Pittsburgh. Certainly in terms of overall experience. The presentation of the sushi was incredible. Even standard rolls (avocado) were better than I expected. They have some really interesting speciality rolls, including one with grilled chicken (yeah..grilled chicken). 

The rest of the food is good, but leaves something to be desired. We got vegetable chow fun, which was good - but not incredible like the sushi. 

I will definitely return.

My only issue is that the base of the car seat is pretty wide and therefore can make it very difficult to ...
4.5 stars! I have bought two of these. There were two reason I decided on the Britax Boulevard. 1. It was rated as one of the easiest car seats to install properly. 2. It has an ARB (Anti Rebound Bar) I've read articles that state that the number one cause of injuries to children in carseats is because the car seat is not installed properly. So #1 was extremely important to me. I have had limited experience with other brands, but I can say that the ClickTight helps get the car seat much tighter much easier than some other models. My only issue is that the base of the car seat is pretty wide and therefore can make it very difficult to reach the tether that is used when utilizing the anchors in the car. Some cars are easier than others, but that is probably the only time consuming part of installing and removing the seat. The strap on the tether is difficult to loosen which makes things harder. The only other negative i have to say is that you have to recline the seat before installing. That may be standard for all car seats, but I found that annoying considering how difficult the seat is to remove and loosen when already installed. That is the only reason i give it a .5 star below a 5. My son was very comfortable in this seat almost immediately... I saw a huge difference in his comfort when comparing to the infant only car seat. Overall, for a convertible car seat, I would highly recommend this one.
Only thing, that you cannot download songs in free version. The makers can limit the downloads to 40-50 so that one can listen even if he is out of network
Excellent next day delivery. Product well packed and in full working order. No complaints!

From making the reservation until the time we walked out of the front door to wander the streets of uptown Charlotte the experience of dining at e2 was simply amazing.

As Ben said I'm not sure what has held me back from e2 for so long, but I'm glad we went when we did and our experience last night has made a fan of me. We will definitely be back. The food was well thought out and prepared to perfection.

I started out with the Oysters on the half shell which were great. The oysters themselves were perfect which I get that the restaurant just really shucks them and puts them on ice but were a great start to a meal. Prior to the oysters they brought out 2 "pre appetizers" made special by the Chef to entice our appetite. We had a salmon paste type plate....very small but just enough to wake up the ol tastebuds. We then had some sort of risotto, ham and the ever popular chantrelle mushroom small plate that was just bursting with perfection.

My Co-Diners had the Yellowfin Tuna Spring Rolls which has now taken over as the Best App in Charlotte IMO. Sushi grade tuna, jalapeno, cucumber and a sprig of cilantro to pull it all together. What a great combination of flavor. Also, I was able to sample the Grilled Peach Salad. Surprisingly fresh Georgia Peaches, Mascarpone cheese which really stood out, basil, honey and I'm still not sure what the heck "Mache" is but I do know that I like it. 

For my entree I had the special NY Strip. 14 glorious oz of perfectly cooked NY Strippy goodness. It was marinated perfectly with worchestershire and seasoned to perfection. It had a cippolini onion chutney which when paired together made me start thinking about when I was coming back. 

We finished up with a few desserts for the table. I am not sure who the Master Dessert Chef they have in the back but give him/her a raise! This person is a genious. Banana Cream Pie which had like 6 layers or something. It was nothing short of exemplary and included banana bread, banana pudding, and shaved chocolate. I could have eaten that as my meal. WOW.

Suffice it to say the service was also impeccable. Attentive and knowledgeable which I would have expected nothing less. They didn't disappoint. For a wonderful dining experience please make your reservation now. You can truly tell these guys know that they're doing. If you're looking for a true dining experience this is your place.

Loved this hotel! People working here are really nice and personable. They made their car and driver available to us when needed and sometimes without asking. rooms are really nice, bed comfy, library a great place to meet friends or just hang out with cocktails. We gathered daily at Boka for happy hour and great food. Perfect location. We walked to Pikes Market, to Duck Tour and to Safeco Stadium for the Dallas Cowboy/Seahawk Football Game. Only thing that would have made it better is if the Cowboys had won!

This book does not try to take itself too seriously. The author does not bog us down with reams of technobabble, or try to impress us with his knowledge of theoretical physics.It is a good story, filled with well developed and interesting characters. Most importantly, it is funny. As much as I enjoy science fiction, I also enjoy having a good laugh, and I got plenty of both here.Around 80%, there were of number of technical errors with the text, with some paragraphs repeating, and some missing entirely. It could be I got a bad download, or maybe a glitch in my device. Either way, I do not hold that against the author. However, there were a number of grammatical errors which I did find distracting. Still, the book overall was very good, and I will probably read more from this author.

Come see them for all of your pet needs!
